articles.author: Felicia Sonmez
articles.title: Rep. Duncan Hunter will resign from Congress on Jan. 13
articles.description: The California Republican’s resignation comes more than one month after he pleaded guilty in federal court to misusing campaign funds.
articles.content:
Hunter and his wife, Margaret, were charged in August 2018 with using more than $250,000 in campaign funds to pay for personal expenses including family vacations, theater tickets and school tuition.
The lawmaker was stripped of his committee assignments but… [+1836 chars]

articles.author: Matthew Cappucci
articles.title: Pollutants from the bush fires in Australia will circle the globe
articles.description: The Australia bush fires have been so intense they've sent particles on a journey around the world.
articles.content: Hundreds of wildfires have ravaged Australia, torching an area nearly the size of West Virginia and sparking vicious fire-induced thunderstorms. Now people more than half a world away, in South America are feeling the effects too, with hazy skies and vibrant … [+5928 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Mexican official: 80% of labor contracts are pro-company
articles.description: Mexico's labor secretary says 80 to 85% of all labor contracts in the country were signed without approval from the workers they covered
articles.content:
U.S. legislators say Mexicos low manufacturing wages of $1 to $1.50 per hour have lured American jobs south of the border.
Mexico has since passed reforms aimed at ensuring secret ballot votes on contracts and effective control by membership over union leade… [+930 chars]

articles.author: Steven Goff
articles.title: Virginia’s Daryl Dike declares for MLS draft
articles.description: The sophomore forward, who helped the Cavaliers advance to the College Cup final last month, is expected to be a top pick.
articles.content: Dike, a 6-foot-2, 220-pound striker, had 10 goals and eight assists in 23 matches in 2019. At the College Cup in Cary, N.C., with numerous MLS coaches and general managers in attendance, he scored twice in the semifinals against Wake Forest and notched a late… [+1599 chars]

articles.author: Mustafa Salim, Liz Sly, Louisa Loveluck
articles.title: Iraq says it has been informed by the U.S. military that troops will be withdrawn
articles.description: The Pentagon says a letter seeming to suggest a U.S. withdrawal from Iraq was imminent was a "mistake." But Iraq says there was no mistake, and it is expecting the troops to go.
articles.content: The letter delivered to the office of Iraqs caretaker prime minister, Adel Abdul Mahdi, on Monday cited deference to a vote in the Iraqi parliament calling on all foreign forces to leave by way of explaining an expected increase in U.S. helicopter activity ov… [+6486 chars]

articles.author: Greg Sargent
articles.title: Memo to Defense Secretary Esper: Trump ordering lawbreaking is not ‘hypothetical’
articles.description: Trump actually did threaten war crimes, and he actually has ordered officials to break the law.
articles.content:
Esper dismissed the notion as a hypothetical. But in an important sense, this isnt a hypothetical at all.
Heres the exchange:
REPORTER: My question is not hypothetical. The president is out there with his position. If you get an order, would you resign from… [+4170 chars]

articles.author: Darlene Superville | AP
articles.title: Trump retreats from threat to attack Iranian cultural sites
articles.description: President Donald Trump is backing away from his threats to target Iranian cultural sites if Tehran retaliates for the killing of a top Iranian general by the U.S. It is a war crime to target cultural sites
articles.content:
But he still sounded offended by the idea that such sites would be off limits during armed conflict.
Think of it, Trump said during an Oval Office appearance. They kill our people. They blow up our people. And then we have to be very gentle with their cultur… [+3186 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Greek PM says IMF to close its Athens offices within months
articles.description: Greece's prime minister says the International Monetary Fund will close its offices in Athens in coming months, about ten years after joining in a huge bailout program that kept the country afloat during its financial crisis
articles.content:
Mitsotakis spoke following a meeting in Washington with the funds new managing director, Kristalina Georgieva.
Greece required three bailouts from its partners in the eurozone and the IMF starting in 2010, to avoid going bust. This became necessary after the… [+845 chars]

articles.author: Kevin Freking | AP
articles.title: Trump applauds Greek 'comeback' in White House meeting
articles.description: President Donald Trump has welcomed the prime minister of Greece to the White House by saying the United States was very proud of the country and "the comeback" it is making
articles.content: Trump and Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis met at a time of high stakes in the Mediterranean region. The Harvard-educated Mitsotakis said his country was following a recipe that has worked in the United States, including lower taxes, and the Greek economy h… [+1367 chars]

articles.title: How to spot a Photoshopped image; or, The Problem with the Internet
articles.description: Tips for members of Congress and other Americans.
